snippet: The Supreme Court should end the Federal Communications Commission’s misguided indecency policy for radio and television broadcasts.
abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court to overturn 1978 ruling that allowed the Federal Communications Commission to impose misguided and vague indecency policy for radio and television; holds same First Amendment freedom of speech principles should apply to all media.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should end the Federal Communications Commission’s misguided indecency policy for radio and television broadcasts.
